page.title: 16 TEMPLE HILL ESTATE
page.content: Temple Hill is a well planned estate and was built between 1952-1960. It consists of grassed areas, shops two public houses, three primary schools and three churches. The estate is situated near the river Thames, with views across the river to Essex. Most of the buildings on the estate are masionettes and terraced houses. There are many activites such as, play schemes, youth clubs and leisure groups. Another new estate being built at the top of Temple Hill is Knights Manor. This estate gets its name from knights that lived there long ago called Knights Templar, and was then farm land. It is now becoming a very pleasant estate with little terrace houses around square gardens.
